title: Four Indigenous children start to share details of their 40 days in the Amazon jungle
description: The siblings are expected to remain for at least two weeks in a Colombian hospital receiving treatment after their rescue Friday.

title: India: Star female wrestlers hold federation head to account for alleged sexual assault
description: Since January, several top wrestlers have been raising awareness about the all-powerful Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, who is also an elected member of the prime minister's party.

title: High-tech: Lessons from a historic wave of job cuts
description: Over 17 months, the high-tech sector has cut more than 365,000 jobs worldwide. The trend seems to have come to an end.

title: The rebirth of Czech animation
description: A generation of filmmakers in their 30s, such as Michaela Pavlátová and Filip Posivac, are striving to recapture the glory of their predecessors. Seven of their films compete at the Annecy Animated Film Festival from June 11 to 17.

title: Water flows again at Versailles's Grand Trianon
description: After more than 18 months of work, the Buffet d'Eau fountain in the gardens of Versailles, designed by Louis XIV, has been restored to its former glory.

title: Novak Djokovic, French Open hero and sole grand slam record holder
description: After his victory over Norway's Casper Ruud in Sunday's final (7-6, 6-3, 7-5), the Serbian player is now the men’s sole grand slam record holder with 23 titles, overtaking Spain's Rafael Nadal.

title: Scotland's former leader Nicola Sturgeon arrested in finance probe
description: The former leader was arrested on June 11 as part of an investigation into the finances of the Scottish National Party which she led for over eight years, police said.

title: Cryptocurrency: Binance and Coinbase targeted by US authorities
description: The Wall Street regulator is accusing the two crypto exchange platforms of multiple violations.

title: 24 Hours of Le Mans: Ferrari topples Toyota after 50-year absence
description: Ferrari won the centenary edition of the iconic sports car race on June 11, besting Toyota after a 50-year absence from the competition.

title: The thousand and one flavors of Israeli cuisine
description: Several Parisian restaurants are championing – and updating – recipes from the Levant, honoring fresh vegetables and delectable spices.

title: Artificial intelligence: Global powers embark upon regulation race
description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak wants his country, which is at the forefront of AI research, to take the lead in regulating the sector. But the European Union is way ahead, while the United States and China are also actively working on the issue.

title: Saudi Arabia and Russia clash over Ukraine and oil
description: Mohammed bin Salman has imposed severe restrictions on Russian oil production just two weeks after inviting the Ukrainian president to the Arab League summit in Jeddah.

title: Montenegro votes in parliamentary election that could determine EU path
description: The Balkan country held an early parliamentary election on June 11, which could put an end to deep political divisions have hampered its path to joining the European Union.

title: UK opposition demands election as Johnson and Conservative MPs resign
description: Opposition leader Keir Starmer demanded a general election on June 11 as three Tory MPs, including Boris Johnson, stepped down from parliament.

title: 'Miracle in the jungle': Colombia celebrates rescue of children lost in Amazon rainforest
description: The four children, aged between 13 and 1, wandered the jungle for forty days after the plane that was carrying them crashed. The military and volunteers from local Indigenous communities rallied to find them.

title: EU27 finally reach agreement on migration policy reform
description: European Union home affairs ministers reached an agreement on two key texts of the pact on asylum and migration, pushing the idea of a "compulsory solidarity" of all countries in the management of asylum seekers.

title: Denmark: Prime Minister Frederiksen's possible appointment as NATO chief sparks debate
description: Social Democrat Mette Frederiksen, head of the coalition government, visited Washington on June 5, meeting Joe Biden.

title: On the frontline, the mysterious Ukrainian strategy in their counter-offensive
description: Though Kyiv maintains its 'operational silence,' a counter-attack phase has begun, as part of the expected major offensive by Ukrainian forces, raising many questions.

title: Fear of a wave of transnational repression among Arab opponents in exile
description: Amman's recent extradition of an Emirati opposition figure, against a backdrop of rapprochement between the region's autocracies, is causing concern among human rights activists.

title: Clashes in Senegal: Ziguinchor's youth 'ready to die for freedom'
description: The population rose up in Dakar and Casamance after the conviction of Ousmane Sonko, Macky Sall's main opponent. At least 23 people have been killed.
